definition: lit. to fall behind Sun Shan 孫山|孙山[Sun1 Shan1] (who came last in the imperial examination) (idiom)/fig. to fail an exam/to fall behind (in a competition)
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
grandson/descendant
surname Sun
surname Shan
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable

sentences.english: This year he failed again in the entrance examination for college students.
sentences.chinese: 今年高考他又名落孙山了。

sentences.english: However, there are still about 30% of the students fallen off.
sentences.chinese: 但是，还是有30%左右的学生名落孙山。

definition: to fail the imperial exams/to flunk
to fail an exam
to pass an exam
the triennial provincial imperial exam during the Ming and Qing
to pass the provincial level imperial examination
to pass a university entrance exam
to fail to be chosen (or elected)/to lose an election
to win top marks in the imperial examinations
to fail the civil service examination (in imperial China)
lit. plucking a branch of osmanthus from the Toad Palace (i.e. the moon)/fig. to succeed in the imperial examination
imperial examination
a person who has passed the county level imperial exam (historical)/scholar/skillful writer/fine talent
imperial examinations (in former times)
successful candidate in the highest imperial civil service examination/palace graduate
graduate/successful candidate in the imperial provincial examination
Sun Shan, Song Dynasty joker and talented scholar
